section.name: EXTJS-30308: Update version number to 8.0.0 in SDK

case.title: Verify the SDK version number 8.0.0 on classic app.

custom.preconds:
Download the latest ext framework from the TeamCity.

Create a new Ext JS application with below command.
   sencha -sdk /path/to/SDK/ext(downloaded from TeamCity in the previous step) generate app NewExtApp app-name (Ex. new-app)

Run "sencha app build" from the root folder.

Run "sencha web start" from the root folder.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to http://localhost:1841/build/production/NewExtApp

  2. Open dev console -> enter "Ext.getVersion()"
custom.expected: At step 2, the ext version of the application should be displayed as 8.0.0.*

case.title: Verify the ext version in package.json file.

custom.preconds: Download the latest ext framework from TeamCity.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to the ext framework downloaded path.

  2. Open ext-8.0.0.* -> package.json file
custom.expected: At step 2, the file should consist of 8.0.0.* version number.

case.title: Verify the ext version of premium packages(ex: Froala-editor)

custom.preconds: Download the latest ext-addons from the TeamCity.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to the ext addons downloaded path.
2. Open ext-addons-8.0.0.* -> packages -> froala editor -> package.json
custom.expected: At step 2, the file should have consisted of 8.0.0 version number.

case.title: Verify the ext version on ext-gen app generation

custom.preconds: Login to npm login --registry=https://test.npm.sencha.com/ --scope=@sencha install ext-gen : npm install -g @sencha/ext-gen
custom.steps:
1. Create an ext-gen: ext-gen app -a
2. Navigate to created app path (cd/pathtoapp/my-app)

4. Verify the EXTJS version in the local application in the default browser.

At step 3, the EXTJS version should be pointed to 8.0.0.* version
At step 4, the EXTJS version should be pointed to 8.0.0.* version

section.name: OTOOLS-118: Open Tooling Support for Ext JS 8.0.0

case.title: Verify the Installation of ExtGen.

custom.preconds: Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) and latest Node JS (20+ till 22.13.1 LTS) in the machine.
custom.steps:
1. Login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com/ --scope=@sencha"

  2. Run "npm install -g @sencha/ext-gen"

  3. Type "ext-gen" in the cmd/terminal.
custom.expected: At Step 3, ext-gen should be successfully installed and pointed to 8.0.0

case.title: Verify the ext move to latest installation.

custom.preconds:
1. Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) and latest Node JS (20+ till 22.13.1 LTS) in the machine.
2. Login to npm using "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com/ --scope=@sencha"
3. To install ext-gen, run "npm install -g @sencha/ext-gen"
4. Create a sample ext-gen app by using "ext-gen app -a"
custom.steps: 1. Navigate to the ext-gen created app from cmd/terminal. 2. Run "npm install -g @sencha/ext-movetolatest" 3. Run "ext-movetolatest" 4. Run "npm install"
custom.expected: At step 4, all the packages should be successfully installed.

case.title: Verify the ext-gen migrate functionality.

custom.preconds:
1. Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) and latest Node JS (20+ till 22.13.1 LTS) in the machine.
2. Download the latest ext and sencha cmd from TeamCity.
3. Create a new Ext JS application with below command. sencha -sdk /path/to/SDK/ext(downloaded from TeamCity in the previous step) generate app NewExtApp app-name (Ex. new-app)
4. Login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com/ --scope=@sencha"
5. To install ext-gen, run "npm install -g @sencha/ext-gen"
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to the root of the Sencha cmd based app.
2. Run "ext-gen migrate" in the cmd/terminal.
custom.expected: At Step 2, the sencha cmd based app should be migrated to ext-gen based application.

case.title: Verify the Ext-gen application building upon Sencha CMD (Jetty) upon JAVA 17 and 21.

custom.preconds:
Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (17 and 21) and latest Node JS (20+ till 22.13.1 LTS) in the machine.
Login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com/ --scope=@sencha"
To install ext-gen, run "npm install -g @sencha/ext-gen"
Steps to download Sencha CMD (Jetty).
Login into npm adduser --registry https://sencha.myget.org/F/commertcial-test-jetty/npm/
Create a folder, run "npm init -y
To download and install Sencha CMD (jetty), run "npm install @sencha/cmd"
Navigate inside node_modules/@sencha/cmd/dist/js/node_modules/fashion inside the downloaded Jetty cmd folder, run "npm install".
custom.steps:
1. Login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com/ --scope=@sencha"
2. Open cmd/terminal and create an app with "ext-gen app -t moderndesktop --moderntheme theme-material -n ModernApp"
3. Replace the downloaded jetty cmd in the path <ModernApp>/node_modules/@sencha/cmd
4. Navigate to the created app in #2 (ex: ModernApp) and type "npm start" and hit enter.
custom.expected: At Step 4, the application should build and automatically launch in the browser with no error.

case.title: Verify the app creation using moderndesktop template on material theme.

custom.preconds:
1. Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) and latest Node JS (20+ till 22.13.1 LTS) in the machine.

  2. Login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com/ --scope=@sencha"

  3. To install ext-gen, run "npm install -g @sencha/ext-gen"
custom.steps:
1. Open cmd/terminal and create an app with "ext-gen app -t  moderndesktop --moderntheme theme-material -n ModernApp"

  2. Navigate to the created app in #1 (ex: ModernApp) and type "npm start" and hit enter.

Note: Repeat the same steps for other themes by changing the theme in the #1 (theme-ios, theme-neptune, theme-triton)
custom.expected:
At step 1, the application should be successfully created with no error in the cmd/terminal.

At step 2, the application should be loaded in the browser with default UI and no error in the console.

case.title: Generate and Build an ExtGen App.

custom.preconds: Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) and latest Node JS (20+ till 22.13.1 LTS) in the machine.
custom.steps:
1. Open cmd/terminal and login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com --scope=@sencha".
  2. Install ext-gen by using "npm install -g @sencha/ext-gen".
  3. Create a sample ext-gen app using "ext-gen app -a".
  4. Navigate to the created app as "cd my-app".
  5. Run "npm start".
  6. Kill the process by ctrl+c
  7. Run "npm run build".
custom.expected:
At step 5, Application should be successfully created and loaded in the browser with default UI and no error in the console.

At step 7, the application should be built with no error in the cmd/terminal.

section.name: DSGNR-8442: Update Sencha Architect to Version 4.3.7 Supporting ExtJS 8.0

case.title: Verify the Sencha Architect to Version 4.3.7.

custom.preconds:
Software and tools.
1. Download and install latest version of Sencha cmd from teamcity. 2. Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) in the machine. 3. Download latest version of Sencha Architect from teamcity.
To install Sencha Architect.
1. Double click on downloaded Sencha Architect file in #3. 2. Click on Next button in "Welcome to the Sencha Architect Setup Wizard" window. 3. Select I accept the agreement radio button in "License Agreement" window and make sure copyrights updated to 2025. 4. Click on Next button in "Select Destination Directory" window. 5. Click on Next button in "Select Start Menu Folder" window. 6. Click on Next button in "Select File Associations" window. 7. Click on Finish button in "Completing the Sencha Architect Setup Wizard " window.
custom.steps: 1. Launch the Sencha Architect app and check the version in the welcome window.
custom.expected: At Step 1, the version of the SA app should be displayed as 4.3.7.

2. Click on New Project.
3. Select EXTJS 8.0.x Classic from Choose your framework with any project (ex: Blank project) and click on Create button.

case.title: Verify the Save functionality.

custom.preconds:
Software and tools.
1. Download and install latest version of Sencha cmd from teamcity. 2. Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) in the machine. 3. Download latest version of Sencha Architect from teamcity.
To install Sencha Architect.
1. Double click on downloaded Sencha Architect file in #3. 2. Click on Next button in "Welcome to the Sencha Architect Setup Wizard" window. 3. Select I accept the agreement radio button in "License Agreement" window and make sure copyrights updated to 2025. 4. Click on Next button in "Select Destination Directory" window. 5. Click on Next button in "Select Start Menu Folder" window. 6. Click on Next button in "Select File Associations" window. 7. Click on Finish button in "Completing the Sencha Architect Setup Wizard " window.
custom.steps:
1. Launch Sencha Architect >> Click on New Project.
2. Create any EXTJS 8.0.x Classic/Modern project(ex: Blank Project).
3. Click on File option and click on Save option.
4. Enter Project Name and click on Save.
5. Click on File option and click on New Project, Select EXTJS 7.8.x Classic/EXTJS 7.8.x Modern from Choose your framework with a blank project and click on Create button.
6. Repeat step3.
7. Don't enter any Project name and click on Save.
8. Repeat step 5 & 3.
9. Enter Project Name and click on Cancel.
10. Repeat step 5 & 3.
11. Enter already existing project name and click on save.
custom.expected:
At step 3, Save Project window should be displayed with Save and Cancel button.
At step 4, the project should be saved successfully.
At step 7, "This field is required" error message should appear when mouse hover on project name text field.
At step 9, No changes should be applied.
At step 11, "A project already exists at this path" error message should be displayed.

case.title: Verify the Exit functionality.

custom.preconds:
Software and tools.
1. Download and install latest version of Sencha cmd from teamcity. 2. Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) in the machine. 3. Download latest version of Sencha Architect from teamcity.
To install Sencha Architect.
1. Double click on downloaded Sencha Architect file in #3. 2. Click on Next button in "Welcome to the Sencha Architect Setup Wizard" window. 3. Select I accept the agreement radio button in "License Agreement" window and make sure copyrights updated to 2025. 4. Click on Next button in "Select Destination Directory" window. 5. Click on Next button in "Select Start Menu Folder" window. 6. Click on Next button in "Select File Associations" window. 7. Click on Finish button in "Completing the Sencha Architect Setup Wizard " window.
custom.steps:
1. Launch Sencha Architect >> Click on New Project.
2. Create any EXTJS 8.0.x Classic/Modern project(ex: Blank Project).
3. Click on the File option and click on the Exit option/(On Mac: Click on Sencha Architect -> Quit Sencha Architect)
4. Repeat Step 1 and 2
5. Click Alt+F4/(On Mac: Click command+Q)
custom.expected: At Step 3 and 5, the Sencha Architect app should be closed successfully.

case.title: Verify the upgrade functionality of application.

custom.preconds:
Software and tools.
1. Download and install latest version of Sencha cmd from teamcity. 2. Install Java (Oracle/OpenJDK (8, 11, 17 and 21)) in the machine. 3. Download latest version of Sencha Architect from teamcity.
To install Sencha Architect.
1. Double click on downloaded Sencha Architect file in #3. 2. Click on Next button in "Welcome to the Sencha Architect Setup Wizard" window. 3. Select I accept the agreement radio button in "License Agreement" window and make sure copyrights updated to 2025. 4. Click on Next button in "Select Destination Directory" window. 5. Click on Next button in "Select Start Menu Folder" window. 6. Click on Next button in "Select File Associations" window. 7. Click on Finish button in "Completing the Sencha Architect Setup Wizard " window.
custom.steps: 1. Launch the Sencha Architect app. 2. Click on the "No" option in the "New Ext JS version is available!" pop-up. 3. Click on the "New Project" button. 4. Create any older version of EXT JS application (Ex: EXT JS 7.4.x app). 5. Save the project, by providing name and project path to be saved. 6. Click on the "Edit" option in the toolbox. 7. Select "Project Settings" option from the context menu. 8. Select "Framework" tab in the "Project Settings" pop-up. 9. Click on the "Upgrade to EXT JS 8.0.x Classic button and observe. 10. Click on the "Yes" button in the confirmation pop-up. 11. Click on the "Upgrade to EXT JS 8.0.x Classic drop-down and select any available updated versions. 12. Click on the "Yes" button in the confirmation pop-up.
custom.expected:
At step 10, the EXT JS 7.4 app should be upgraded to latest EXT JS version (8.0.x) with no error..
At step 12, the EXT JS 7.4 app should be ugraded to user selected version with no error

section.name: EJUA-35: Update Upgrade Adviser and ESLint Plugin to Support Ext JS 8.0

case.title: Verify test file plugin from classic 4.0.x to 8.0.x version.

custom.preconds:
To get sampleapps:
Clone to repo: https://github.com/sencha/ext-upgrade-adviser
Open terminal/cmd: navigate to /path to/ext-upgrade-advisor/sampleapps
Run "npm install"
custom.steps:
1. Launch the application.
2. Select Classic from the toolkit drop-down, select 4.0.x from the current version drop-down, and select 8.0.x from the Upgrading drop-down.
3. Select File from the drop-down and browse the path as /path to upgrade advisor/sampleapps/ext40app/app/view/Testrail.js
4. Click on the Analyze button.
5. Click on the Export button.
custom.expected:
At Step4, the Following data should be seen in the console. 21 problems (3 errors, 18 warnings) 0 errors and 3 warnings potentially fixable.
At Step5, File should be exported to the machine.

4. Click on the Analyze button.
5. Click on the Export button.
custom.expected:
At Step4, the following data should be seen in the console. 15 problems (0 errors, 15 warnings) 0 errors and 2 warnings potentially fixable.
At Step5, File should be exported to the machine.

case.title: Verify test file plugin from classic 4.0.x to 8.0.x version.

custom.preconds:
To install ESLint plugin:
1. Open any terminal/cmd, login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com --scope=@sencha"
2. Run "npm install @sencha/eslint-plugin-extjs@latest --save-dev"
Note: Check with eslint 7, 8, 9 versions.
To get sampleapps:
1. Clone to repo: https://github.com/sencha/ext-upgrade-adviser
2. Open terminal/cmd: navigate to /path to/ext-upgrade-advisor/sampleapps
3. Run "npm install"
custom.steps:
1. Open the terminal/Cmd, navigate to /path to/ext-upgrade-advisor/sampleapps/ext40app
2. Run "npx eslint app/view/TestRail.js"
custom.expected:
At Step2, the following output should be displayed.

case.title: Verify test folder plugin from classic 4.1.x to 8.0.x version.

custom.preconds:
To install ESLint plugin:
1. Open any terminal/cmd, login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com --scope=@sencha"
2. Run "npm install @sencha/eslint-plugin-extjs@latest --save-dev"
Note: Check with eslint 7, 8, 9 versions.
To get sampleapps:
1. Clone to repo: https://github.com/sencha/ext-upgrade-adviser
2. Open terminal/cmd: navigate to /path to/ext-upgrade-advisor/sampleapps
3. Run "npm install"

case.title: Verify test folder plugin from classic 5.0.x to 8.0.x version.

custom.preconds:
To install ESLint plugin:
1. Open any terminal/cmd, login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com --scope=@sencha"
2. Run "npm install @sencha/eslint-plugin-extjs@latest --save-dev"
Note: Check with eslint 7, 8, 9 versions.
To get sampleapps:
1. Clone to repo: https://github.com/sencha/ext-upgrade-adviser
2. Open terminal/cmd: navigate to /path to/ext-upgrade-advisor/sampleapps
3. Run "npm install"

case.title: Verify test file plugin from classic 4.0.x to 8.0.x version.

custom.preconds:
To install ESLint plugin:
1. Open any terminal/cmd, login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com --scope=@sencha"
2. Run "npm install @sencha/eslint-plugin-extjs@latest --save-dev"
Note: Check with eslint 7, 8, 9 versions.
To get sampleapps:
1. Clone to repo: https://github.com/sencha/ext-upgrade-adviser
2. Open terminal/cmd: navigate to /path to/ext-upgrade-advisor/sampleapps
3. Run "npm install"

case.title: Verify test folder plugin from classic 4.2.x to 8.0.x version.

custom.preconds:
To install ESLint plugin:
1. Open any terminal/cmd, login to "npm login --registry=http://test.npm.sencha.com --scope=@sencha"
2. Run "npm install @sencha/eslint-plugin-extjs@latest --save-dev"
Note: Check with eslint 7, 8, 9 versions.
To get sampleapps:
1. Clone to repo: https://github.com/sencha/ext-upgrade-adviser
2. Open terminal/cmd: navigate to /path to/ext-upgrade-advisor/sampleapps
3. Run "npm install"
custom.steps:
1. Launch the Visual Studio with sampleapps folder.
2. Open the Terminal: \path to\ext-upgrade-advisor\sampleapps\ext42app
3. Run "npx eslint app/view"
custom.expected:
At Step2, the following output should be displayed.

section.name: SDKTOOLS-2204: Update Sencha Cmd to Support Ext JS 8.0

case.title: Verify Sencha cmd support for 8.0

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
  2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
  3. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps:
1. Install the latest Sencha cmd file on the machine.

  2. Open cmd/terminal, type sencha and hit enter.
custom.expected: At Step 2, the sencha cmd 8.0 version should be successfully installed on the machine.

case.title: Verify the app creation with sencha cmd.

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
3. Download the latest 8.0 Extjs framework from TeamCity.
4. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps: 1. Generate the app with sencha cmd : sencha -sdk /path/to/extjs8.0/ generate app NewExtApp new-app
custom.expected: At Step 1, the extjs application should be generated with sencha cmd 8.0.0.

case.title: Verify sencha app build in production mode.

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
3. Download the latest 8.0 Extjs framework from TeamCity.
4. Generate the app with sencha cmd : sencha -sdk /path/to/extjs8.0/ generate app NewExtApp appname(ex: new-app)
5. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate inside the created app path in cmd or terminal.
2. Run "sencha app build"
custom.expected: At Step 2, App should be built successfully on the production mode.

case.title: Verify sencha app watch.

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
3. Download the latest 8.0 Extjs framework from TeamCity.
4. Generate the app with sencha cmd : sencha -sdk /path/to/extjs8.0/ generate app NewExtApp appname(ex: new-app)
5. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to a created app on cmd or terminal.
2. Run "sencha app watch".
custom.expected: At Step 2, App should be loaded and pointed to the available port in the machine.

case.title: Verify cmd generate view.

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
3. Download the latest 8.0 Extjs framework from TeamCity.
4. Generate the app with sencha cmd : sencha -sdk /path/to/extjs8.0/ generate app NewExtApp appname(ex: new-app)
5. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to the created app in the cmd or terminal.
2. Run "sencha generate view [options] name" ex: sencha generate view demo.demo
custom.expected: At Step 2, the demo folder should be created and should consist of demo.js, demoController.js, demoModel.js inside the view folder under the app folder.

case.title: Verify cmd generate package.

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
3. Download the latest 8.0 Extjs framework from TeamCity.
4. Generate the app with sencha cmd : sencha -sdk /path/to/extjs8.0/ generate app NewExtApp appname(ex: new-app)
5. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to the created app folder on cmd or terminal.
2. Run "sencha generate package package name" ex: sencha generate package sample
custom.expected: At Step2, The package (ex: sample) should get created inside the package folder under created app directory.

case.title: Verify cmd generate theme.

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
3. Download the latest 8.0 Extjs framework from TeamCity.
4. Generate the app with sencha cmd : sencha -sdk /path/to/extjs8.0/ generate app NewExtApp appname(ex: new-app)
5. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to the created app folder on cmd or terminal.
2. Run "sencha generate theme theme-name " ex: sencha generate theme ext-theme-material
custom.expected: At Step2, the theme (ex: ext-theme-material) should be created inside the packages/local under created app directory.

case.title: Verify sencha app build in testing mode.

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
3. Download the latest 8.0 Extjs framework from TeamCity.
4. Generate the app with sencha cmd : sencha -sdk /path/to/extjs8.0/ generate app NewExtApp appname(ex: new-app)
5. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate inside the created app path in cmd or terminal.
2. Run "sencha app build testing"
custom.expected: At Step2, The application should be built in testing mode.

case.title: Verify the java exception with sencha app watch command.

custom.preconds:
1. Install java 8-21(oracle/OpenJDK).
2. Download the latest Sencha Cmd 8.0 from TeamCity.
3. Download the latest 8.0 Extjs framework from TeamCity.
4. Generate the app with sencha cmd : sencha -sdk /path/to/extjs8.0/ generate app NewExtApp appname(ex: new-app)
5. Test this scenario on both continous and jetty CMD builds.
custom.steps:
1. Navigate to a created app on cmd or terminal.
2. Run "sencha app watch".
custom.expected: At Step2, a. App should be loaded and pointed to the available port in the machine(ex:localhost:1841) b. No java exception should thrown while loading the app.
